= Bajos=

Welcome to the bajos wiki!

Bajos is a Java runtime environment for microcontrollers. It consists of BAJVM, a Java Virtual Machine and of BAJOSBOOT, a collection of system classes. BAJOS can be adapted to Embedded Systems with/without operating system and has been tested for 8 and 32 bit AVR controllers (atmega128,UC3A, AP7000). It works on PC's with linux also.
Bajos has been tested at:<br>
- 32 Bit and 64 Bit PC-linux systems (most development and testing is carried out here)
- MICA2 Board (mote) with atmega128 only equipped with internal 4K Byte data ram
- Charon2 board with atmega128 and 32K data ram and resident monitor program bamo128
    ( see http://code.google.com/p/bamo128 )
- NGW100 with/without linux
- STK1000 with/without linux
- EVK1100 with/without resident monitor bamo32 (see cs.ba-berlin.de)
- EVK1104 with/without resident monitor bamo32
- ArduinoMega (http://arduino.cc/en/Main/ArduinoBoardMega) with/without resident monitor bamo128
- XPLAIN- board with atxmega128A1 (in development, see this repository)

Check download area for latest stable revision.
